result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clinton Joseph Lemek

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No entrance into bars or taverns, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a doctor's prescription and take as prescribed, Drug and alcohol testing by law enforcement at defendants expense.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:30 PM  Defendant Clinton Joseph Lemek appeared by phone.  Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder appeared by phone for Clinton Joseph Lemek.  Attorney Adam C Sticht appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. | Charges, possible penalties and rights read.  $2000 signature bond with conditions No entrance into bars or taverns, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a doctor's prescription and take as prescribed, Drug and alcohol testing by law enforcement at defendants expense.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
